org.joty.workstation.gui

Class BlobComponent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.joty.workstation.gui.BlobComponent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, Term.TermEnclosable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImageComponent

    public class BlobComponent
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements Term.TermEnclosable
    It is a visual class, descending from JPanel, that manages the storing and the retrieving of a binary object into and from the database, through the web or directly.

    Actually the retrieving is even performed as a multiple object operation, that is performed on several record of the binary database field, by means of the ActionIterationActor delegated internal instance.

    The class defines a set of four small buttons each of them having the following task acting on the binary object: opening, uploading, deleting, downloading.

    Differently from all other Joty visual objects managing the datum living in a database field, a BlobComponent instance is enabled acting when the containing DataAccessDialog instance id not in the 'editing' state. This choice has been made to keep things simple and robust from the point of view of the software factory, with a little loss of comfort for the user that has to familiarize with this special object that does not participate in the editing session of the dialog.

    See Also:
    BlobComponent.ActionIterationActor, Serialized Form
